# equivalentContentTintColor

**Instance Property**

A color object that matches the effective content tint.

## Declaration

```swift
var equivalentContentTintColor: NSColor? { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor] that matches the represented content tint. This property is `nil` if the system can’t represent the content tint as an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor].

## Setting the Tint Color

- **default**: The system tints the content using the system default value for its context.
- **monochrome**: The content always displays in monochrome.
- **baseTintColor**: The color the system supplies when you create a tint configuration.
